image.altText: A woman stands in front of a house that is under construction.

props.synopsis: Cindy Richardson signed up with Perth builder Nicheliving more than three years ago. She's now overwhelmed with bills and hoping to access her super to stay afloat.

title.children: Cindy was supposed to be living in a new home by now. Instead she's facing bankruptcy

image.altText: David Pocock Fatima Payman 20220726_002553490_iOS

props.synopsis: Suspended Labor MP Fatima Payman has enlisted the advice of a minor party political "whisperer" as her party colleagues brace themselves for the possibility she will move to the cross bench.

title.children: Fatima Payman enlists minor party specialist as Labor braces for backlash

image.altText: A man in a suit talks to a group of people.

props.synopsis: UK cities are broke, utility prices are sky high and the cost of living is barely affordable. Sir Keir Starmer is likely to become just the fourth Labour leader to win an election, if he does so his task is monumental.

title.children: A knight from a working-class background: Sir Keir Starmer may soon be charged with saving Britain

image.altText: Rows of cars in a car park, with stacked shipping containers behind them.

props.synopsis: A loophole in the government's New Vehicle Efficiency Standard could be exploited by car makers seeking to import higher-polluting vehicles, and would undermine the first three years of the new climate laws.Â

title.children: Car import loophole allows manufacturers to rush polluting vehicles into Australia

image.altText: A woman with short blonde hair looks off to the side standing in front of a pink cosmetics display.

props.synopsis: Australian cosmetics company MCoBeauty has become a multi-million-dollar business by "duping" popular beauty products. But its success hasn't been without controversy, after pushing the boundaries of the law too far in the past.

title.children: In the makeup world, there's a fine line between duping and being sued. MCoBeauty found out the hard way

image.altText: Donald Trump looks stern with US flag behind him.

props.synopsis: America's highest court finds ex-presidents have significant protection from criminal prosecution â a historic ruling that's prompted an appeal of Donald Trump's criminal conviction.Â

title.children: Trump seeks to overturn New York hush money fraud convictions after Supreme Court immunity ruling

image.altText: Police officers stand behind police tape at the scene of a stabbing

props.synopsis: Police say a motive or ideology has not been determined after a 14-year-old boy allegedly stabbed a student in the neck on the grounds of the University of Sydney this morning.

title.children: 14yo boy accused of stabbing Sydney uni student in neck was dressed in camouflage, police say

image.altText: Assange and Robinson sit in plane seats, looking happy.

props.synopsis: For the first time, two of the people closest to the negotiations to free Julian Assange have revealed what it took to convince the United States to release the man who had published hundreds of thousands of their most secret documents.

title.children: As Julian Assange languished in a British prison, Anthony Albanese passed a message to his lawyers that would prove a turning point

image.altText: Tomatoes floating in muddy water in lane of tomato paddock

props.synopsis: Some might think rain is good for growing, but for Gascoyne growers June's accumulative total of 104.4mm has been too much for their tomatoes to handle.

title.children: Gascoyne's heavy rains are a washout for winter seasonal tomato growers

image.altText: a man of african descent stands behind a pool fence

props.synopsis: Tuck was sitting in the pool area of his own apartment complex when police arrested him, believing he was trespassing. He says it wouldn't have happened had it not been for his physical appearance.

title.children: 'Extraordinary over-reaction': Man accuses police of racial profiling after arrest for trespassing at his own home

image.altText: A man wearing a car backwards stands by a bright green car, with its doors open.

props.synopsis: The man who stole international tennis star Nick Kyrgios's green Tesla from the player's mother at gunpoint is sentenced to four-and-a-half years' jail in the ACT Supreme Court.

title.children: Man who stole Nick Kyrgios's Tesla and held his mother at gunpoint jailed for more than four years

image.altText: More revelations in the Jeffrey Epstein investigation

props.synopsis: The Florida investigations uncovered Epstein's close ties to former President Bill Clinton and Britain's Prince Andrew, and his once-friendly relationship with former President Donald Trump.

title.children: Newly released transcripts show prosecutors knew of Jeffrey Epstein's underage abuse prior to lenient plea deal

image.altText: The silhouette of a soldier holding a large gun in the window of a home.

props.synopsis: As the war in Ukraine drags into its third year, some Russian soldiers have decided to flee the front lines. This is how they did it.

title.children: 'I ran away, and now they're all dead': The Russian soldiers who escaped the front lines

image.altText: Dave the dog

props.synopsis: Melissa McDougall fears someone will be seriously injured after her son was menaced and her dog was badly injured by two dingoes on Broome's Cable Beach â the fifth attack of its kind in less than a year.

title.children: Dog owner worried what's next after puppy attacked by dingoes on popular beach

image.altText: Jackie Lambie Network MPs and Jacqui Lambie composite image.

props.synopsis: The Jacqui Lambie Network trio of MPs were criticised for surrendering their independence when they signed an agreement with Tasmania's minority Liberal government last April. After three months in their new role, the three have signalled they intend to renegotiate the deal.

title.children: Jacqui Lambie Network Tasmanian MPs flag intention to renegotiate deal with minority Liberal government

image.altText: Woman sitting on a park bench.

props.synopsis: Non-fatal strangulation, or choking during sex, is becoming mainstream among young people in Australia â fuelled by pornography and popular culture. It's prompted concerns that those engaging in the practice are not aware of the serious health risks.Â

title.children: Choking during sex can cause brain injuries but many young Australians are taking up the act

image.altText: An out of focus man and woman walk past a building with glass sliding doors and a sign reading Reserve Bank of Australia.

props.synopsis: Australia's much-discussed narrow path out of the inflation fight is rapidly turning into a highwire act. While one more rate hike from the RBA could cause a recession, holding back if inflation accelerates further will damage its credibility.

title.children: We're richer than everyone else. But one more rate hike could change that

image.altText: Bob Katter wearing sunglasses in QT

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese is considering whether a portrait should be commissioned to pay tribute to the "institution" that is Kennedy MP Bob Katter.Â

title.children: PM considering push to immortalise Bob Katter in portrait  â as it happened

image.altText: An unidentified woman stands in front of the Wheel of Brisbane.

props.synopsis: What started as after-work drinks on a Friday evening quickly turned into a nightmare when Jessica* arrived at a popular bar in central Brisbane.

title.children: 'I was completely paralytic': Jessica doesn't know what her drink was spiked with â and that's part of the problem

image.altText: Barry Foreman leans on a box inside a Fedex warehouse

props.synopsis: More people are retiring later in life. Here's how these Australians stay happy and engaged at work.Â

title.children: This 77-year-old is thriving alongside his Gen Z colleagues. Here's his secret to career longevity

image.altText: A pen full of merino sheep with one looking directly at the camera.

props.synopsis: Laws to phase out Australia's live sheep export trade by 2028 pass parliament, despite last-ditch attempts by opponents to put the brakes on the legislation.

title.children: Laws to ban live sheep exports by 2028 pass parliament following lengthy debate

image.altText: A notice in a supermarket that consumers can only purchase two cartons of eggs

props.synopsis: Consumers can expect to pay more for eggs at the check-out in coming weeks as one of Australia's biggest fast-food retail chains limits its breakfast times.

title.children: McDonald's cuts back breakfast hours across Australia over egg supply concerns

image.altText: sir ian

props.synopsis: Sir Ian McKellen has withdrawn from his UK tour of Player Kings after he fell off the stage mid-performance at a London theatre last month.Â

title.children: Ian McKellen won't return to theatre role after fall from stage

image.altText: Singer John Farnham sitting at a restaurant with his wife, son, and son's wife melissa at the table with him

props.synopsis: The iconic Australian singer is honoured by family members as he marks the milestone.

title.children: John Farnham pictured celebrating his 75th birthday with wife and son

image.altText: A short six legged black and silver robot walks in front of a human's legs on the footpath

props.synopsis: No bark and no bite, but this guide dog could help millions of visually impaired people across China and the globe, says a group of Shanghai researchers working on the six-legged robot prototype.Â

title.children: Could robots replace man's best friend as guide dogs?

image.altText: An aerial view of a combine harvester on a crop.

props.synopsis: Diesel accounts for about 85 per cent of the energy used on Australian farms, but that mix is expected to change as alternative fuels and renewable technology become more affordable.

title.children: Can agriculture be weaned off diesel? Some farmers are finding it harder than others to decarbonise

image.altText: Alex Sarr dunks the basketball playing for Perth

props.synopsis: Alex Sarr is the latest player to spend a season in Australia's NBL before becoming a top-10 pick in the NBA draft. Here's the story of how a player born in France went from Madrid to Atlanta to Perth to the NBA.

title.children: How a season in Perth launched 'special' NBA draftee Alex Sarr and secured another major win for Australian basketball

image.altText: A family walking backwards.

props.synopsis: It's the first time in more than 50 years that an infectious disease is among the five leading causes of death in Australia.

title.children: Life expectancy in Australia has fallen for the first time in about 30 years

image.altText: A close up of a hand with a bracelet, holding a smartphone that shows dating app Tinder.

props.synopsis: Jaryn Timosevski is sentenced in the ACT Supreme Court after pleading guilty to three counts of rape and one act of indecency, after the girl reported the abuse to police.Â

title.children: 'She might be underaged': Court hears details of texts sent by Canberra man who raped 13-year-old he met on Tinder

image.altText: ASX in Sydney

props.synopsis: Australia's share market lost ground, as the minutes of the recent Reserve Bank Board meeting showed officials are concerned about "upside risks" to inflation. Look back on our blog to see how today's events unfolded.

title.children: ASX loses ground, RBA Board minutes show concern about heightened inflation risks â as it happened

image.altText: A man in suit waving South Korean national flag.

props.synopsis: An online petition for the impeachment of Yoon Suk Yeol is closing in on 1 million signatures, leading to delays and disruptions of the website.Â

title.children: 'Public anger': Hundreds of thousands sign online petition demanding impeachment of President Yoon

image.altText: albo paralympic team use

props.synopsis: Three years after falling down the medal tally at the 2021 Games in Tokyo, the Australian Paralympic team believes they are "one of the strongest" to represent the country.

title.children: Australia's 'superhuman' para-athletes look to bounce back in Paris

image.altText: Cristiano Ronaldo is consoled by Diogo Dalot

props.synopsis: Cristiano Ronaldo's tears turn to triumph as Portugal's goalkeeper turns in an all-time penalty shootout performance, while Belgium's golden generation's heartache continues after losing to France and an England star is under investigation.

title.children: Five quick hits â Ronaldo's tears turn to triumph as keeper's penalty heroics save Portugal, England star under investigation over celebration

image.altText: man and woman standing in the mud

props.synopsis: Unseasonal mid-winter rain makes for a muddy beginning to Australia's most remote music festival â but these punters wouldn't have it any other way.

title.children: Big Red Bash kicks off in Birdsville as sun rises over soggy festival grounds for the second year in a row
